required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 16, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Observational Retrospective Register of Spanish Lung Cancer Patients With COVID19 Disease

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a multi-centre study on lung cancer patients which experienced COVID-19. Information on clinical features, clinical course, management and outcomes will be collected for both, thoracic cancers and COVID-19 infection. Firstly, investigators will be registered in an online secure registry. After that, a protocol will be developed in order to collect clinical data for the research. It will also include I on the care organization or the perception of the patient and their family members.
The final stage will consist on retrospective data collection from patients. So, it is a retrospective study data collection, preceded by prospective data registry.

primary_outcome.measure: Clinical data of lung cancer patients with COVID-19 diagnoses
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the diagnosis of the COVID until the patient is cured or dies, whichever comes first, assessed up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Describe characteristics and evolution of Spanish patients preferably with lung cancer who contract COVID 19 infection with identification and study of factors of interest, as well as clinical data.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the diagnosis of the COVID until the patient is cured or dies, whichever comes first, assessed up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Describe characteristics and evolution of Spanish patients preferably with lung cancer who contract COVID 19 infection with identification and study of factors of interest, as well as data about diagnosis

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the diagnosis of the COVID until the patient is cured or dies, whichever comes first, assessed up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Describe characteristics and evolution of Spanish patients preferably with lung cancer who contract COVID 19 infection with identification and study of factors of interest, as well as treatments received

primary_outcome.time_frame: From the diagnosis of the COVID until the patient is cured or dies, whichever comes first, assessed up to 5 years
primary_outcome.description: Describe characteristics and evolution of Spanish patients preferably with lung cancer who contract COVID 19 infection with identification and study of factors of interest, as well as prognostic factors.

arm_group.description: lung cancer patients diagnosed with COVID-19

study_pop.textblock: Patients diagnosed with lung cancer and who have been infected with COVID-19.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with lung cancer
- Patients who have contracted COVID-19 infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed with lung cancer but no confirmation of COVID-19 infection.
